info.title: Dexto API
info.description: OpenAPI spec for the Dexto REST API server

tags.name: messages
tags.description: Send messages to the agent and manage conversations

tags.name: llm
tags.description: Configure and switch between LLM providers and models

tags.name: mcp
tags.description: Manage Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers and tools

tags.name: webhooks
tags.description: Register and manage webhook endpoints for agent events

tags.name: memory
tags.description: Store and retrieve agent memories for context

tags.name: resources
tags.description: Access and manage resources from MCP servers and internal providers

tags.name: agent
tags.description: Current agent configuration and file operations

tags.name: agents
tags.description: Install, switch, and manage agent configurations

get.description: Returns server health status

post.description: Send a message to the agent (A2A message/send)

message.description: Message to send to the agent

get.description: List all A2A tasks with optional filtering (A2A tasks/list)

parameters.description: Filter by context ID
parameters.name: contextId

parameters.description: Filter by task state
parameters.name: status

parameters.description: Number of results (1-100, default 50)
parameters.name: pageSize

schema.description: Pagination token (not yet implemented - reserved for future use)

parameters.description: Pagination token (not yet implemented - reserved for future use)
parameters.name: pageToken

schema.description: Limit history items (not yet implemented - reserved for future use)

parameters.description: Limit history items (not yet implemented - reserved for future use)
parameters.name: historyLength

schema.description: Unix timestamp filter (not yet implemented - reserved for future use)

parameters.description: Unix timestamp filter (not yet implemented - reserved for future use)
parameters.name: lastUpdatedAfter

schema.description: Include artifacts in response (not yet implemented - reserved for future use)

parameters.description: Include artifacts in response (not yet implemented - reserved for future use)
parameters.name: includeArtifacts

pageSize.description: Number of tasks in this page

get.description: Retrieve a specific task by ID (A2A tasks/get)

parameters.description: Task ID
parameters.name: id

post.description: Cancel a running task (A2A tasks/cancel)

parameters.description: Task ID
parameters.name: id

get.description: Retrieves the greeting message from the agent configuration

schema.description: Session identifier to retrieve session-specific greeting

parameters.description: Session identifier to retrieve session-specific greeting
parameters.name: sessionId

post.description: Sends a message and returns immediately. The full response will be sent over SSE

sessionId.description: The session to use for this message

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the image (e.g., image/png)

imageData.description: Optional image data to include with the message

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the file (e.g., application/pdf)

fileData.description: Optional file data to include with the message

schema.description: Request body for sending a message to the agent

202.description: Message accepted for async processing; subscribe to SSE for results

sessionId.description: Session ID used for this message

post.description: Sends a message and waits for the full response

sessionId.description: The session to use for this message

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the image (e.g., image/png)

imageData.description: Optional image data to include with the message

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the file (e.g., application/pdf)

fileData.description: Optional file data to include with the message

schema.description: Request body for sending a message to the agent

sessionId.description: Session ID used for this message

reasoning.description: Extended thinking content from reasoning models

post.description: Resets the conversation history for a given session

sessionId.description: The ID of the session to reset

schema.description: Request body for resetting a conversation

status.description: Status message indicating reset was initiated

post.description: Sends a message and streams the response via Server-Sent Events (SSE). Returns SSE stream directly in response. Events include llm:thinking, llm:chunk, llm:tool-call, llm:tool-result, llm:response, and llm:error.

sessionId.description: The session to use for this message

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the image (e.g., image/png)

imageData.description: Optional image data to include with the message

mimeType.description: The MIME type of the file (e.g., application/pdf)

fileData.description: Optional file data to include with the message

schema.description: Request body for sending a message to the agent

200.description: SSE stream of agent events. Standard SSE format with event type and JSON data.

schema.description: Server-Sent Events stream. Events: llm:thinking (start), llm:chunk (text fragments), llm:tool-call (tool execution), llm:tool-result (tool output), llm:response (final), llm:error (errors)

get.description: Retrieves the current LLM configuration for the agent or a specific session

schema.description: Session identifier to retrieve session-specific LLM configuration

parameters.description: Session identifier to retrieve session-specific LLM configuration
parameters.name: sessionId

model.description: Specific model name for the selected provider

baseURL.description: Base URL for provider (e.g., https://api.openai.com/v1). Only certain providers support this.

maxInputTokens.description: Max input tokens for history; required for unknown models

allowedMediaTypes.description: MIME type patterns for media expansion (e.g., "image/*", "application/pdf"). If omitted, uses model capabilities from registry. Supports wildcards.

hasApiKey.description: Whether an API key is configured

get.description: Providers, models, capabilities, and API key status

schema.description: Comma-separated list of LLM providers to filter by

parameters.name: provider

schema.description: Filter by API key presence (true or false)

parameters.description: Filter by API key presence (true or false)
parameters.name: hasKey

schema.description: Filter by router type (vercel or in-built)

parameters.description: Filter by router type (vercel or in-built)
parameters.name: router

schema.description: Filter by supported file type (audio, pdf, or image)

parameters.description: Filter by supported file type (audio, pdf, or image)
parameters.name: fileType

schema.description: Include only default models (true or false)

parameters.description: Include only default models (true or false)
parameters.name: defaultOnly

schema.description: Response format mode (grouped by provider or flat list)

parameters.description: Response format mode (grouped by provider or flat list)
parameters.name: mode

primaryEnvVar.description: Primary environment variable for API key

supportedRouters.description: Routing strategies supported by this provider

supportsBaseURL.description: Whether custom base URLs are supported

default.description: Whether this is a default model

cacheReadPerM.description: Cache read cost per million tokens

cacheWritePerM.description: Cache write cost per million tokens

pricing.description: Pricing information in USD per million tokens

items.description: Flattened model entry with provider information

models.description: Flat list of all models with provider information

schema.description: LLM catalog in grouped or flat format based on mode query parameter

post.description: Stores an API key for a provider in .env and makes it available immediately

apiKey.description: API key for the provider (writeOnly - never returned in responses)

schema.description: Request body for saving a provider API key

provider.description: Provider for which the key was saved

envVar.description: Environment variable name where key was stored

post.description: Switches the LLM configuration for the agent or a specific session

model.description: Specific model name for the selected provider

apiKey.description: API key for provider; can be given directly or via $ENV reference

baseURL.description: Base URL for provider (e.g., https://api.openai.com/v1). Only certain providers support this.

maxInputTokens.description: Max input tokens for history; required for unknown models

allowedMediaTypes.description: MIME type patterns for media expansion (e.g., "image/*", "application/pdf"). If omitted, uses model capabilities from registry. Supports wildcards.

sessionId.description: Session identifier for session-specific LLM configuration

schema.description: LLM switch request body with optional session ID and LLM fields

model.description: Specific model name for the selected provider

baseURL.description: Base URL for provider (e.g., https://api.openai.com/v1). Only certain providers support this.

maxInputTokens.description: Max input tokens for history; required for unknown models

allowedMediaTypes.description: MIME type patterns for media expansion (e.g., "image/*", "application/pdf"). If omitted, uses model capabilities from registry. Supports wildcards.

hasApiKey.description: Whether an API key is configured

config.description: New LLM configuration with all defaults applied (apiKey omitted)

get.description: Retrieves a list of all active sessions

createdAt.description: Creation timestamp (Unix ms, null if unavailable)

lastActivity.description: Last activity timestamp (Unix ms, null if unavailable)

messageCount.description: Total number of messages in session

post.description: Creates a new session

sessionId.description: A custom ID for the new session

schema.description: Request body for creating a new session

createdAt.description: Creation timestamp (Unix ms, null if unavailable)

lastActivity.description: Last activity timestamp (Unix ms, null if unavailable)

messageCount.description: Total number of messages in session

get.description: Fetches details for a specific session

parameters.description: Session identifier
parameters.name: sessionId

createdAt.description: Creation timestamp (Unix ms, null if unavailable)

lastActivity.description: Last activity timestamp (Unix ms, null if unavailable)

messageCount.description: Total number of messages in session

delete.description: Permanently deletes a session and all its conversation history. This action cannot be undone

parameters.description: Session identifier
parameters.name: sessionId

patch.description: Updates the title of an existing session

parameters.description: Session identifier
parameters.name: sessionId

title.description: New title for the session (maximum 120 characters)

lastActivity.description: Last activity timestamp (Unix ms, null if unavailable)

messageCount.description: Total number of messages in session

items.description: Message content part (text, image, or file)

content.description: Message content (string, null, or array of parts)

id.description: Unique identifier for this tool call

type.description: Tool call type (currently only function is supported)

name.description: Name of the function to call

arguments.description: Arguments for the function in JSON string format

items.description: Tool call made by the assistant

toolCalls.description: Tool calls made by the assistant

toolCallId.description: ID of the tool call this message responds to

name.description: Name of the tool that produced this result

history.description: Array of messages in conversation history

post.description: Cancels an in-flight agent run for the specified session

parameters.description: Session identifier
parameters.name: sessionId

get.description: Validates and retrieves session information. The client should track the active session.

parameters.description: Session identifier
parameters.name: sessionId

createdAt.description: Creation timestamp (Unix ms, null if unavailable)

lastActivity.description: Last activity timestamp (Unix ms, null if unavailable)

messageCount.description: Total number of messages in session

post.description: Generates a descriptive title for the session using the first user message. Returns existing title if already set.

parameters.description: Session identifier
parameters.name: sessionId

title.description: Generated title, or null if generation failed

404.description: Session not found (error format handled by middleware)

get.description: Searches for messages across all sessions or within a specific session

parameters.description: Search query string
parameters.name: q

schema.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 20)

parameters.description: Maximum number of results to return (default: 20)
parameters.name: limit

schema.description: Number of results to skip for pagination (default: 0)

parameters.description: Number of results to skip for pagination (default: 0)
parameters.name: offset

schema.description: Limit search to a specific session

parameters.description: Limit search to a specific session
parameters.name: sessionId

parameters.description: Filter by message role
parameters.name: role

sessionId.description: Session ID where the message was found

items.description: Message content part (text, image, or file)

content.description: Message content (string, null, or array of parts)

id.description: Unique identifier for this tool call

type.description: Tool call type (currently only function is supported)

name.description: Name of the function to call

arguments.description: Arguments for the function in JSON string format

items.description: Tool call made by the assistant

toolCalls.description: Tool calls made by the assistant

toolCallId.description: ID of the tool call this message responds to

name.description: Name of the tool that produced this result

message.description: The message that matched the search

matchedText.description: The specific text that matched the search query

context.description: Context around the match for preview

messageIndex.description: Index of the message within the session

hasMore.description: Whether there are more results beyond the current page

get.description: Searches for sessions that contain the specified query

parameters.description: Search query string
parameters.name: q

matchCount.description: Number of messages that matched in this session

sessionId.description: Session ID where the message was found

items.description: Message content part (text, image, or file)

content.description: Message content (string, null, or array of parts)

id.description: Unique identifier for this tool call

type.description: Tool call type (currently only function is supported)

name.description: Name of the function to call

arguments.description: Arguments for the function in JSON string format

items.description: Tool call made by the assistant

toolCalls.description: Tool calls made by the assistant

toolCallId.description: ID of the tool call this message responds to

name.description: Name of the tool that produced this result

message.description: The message that matched the search

matchedText.description: The specific text that matched the search query

context.description: Context around the match for preview

messageIndex.description: Index of the message within the session

firstMatch.description: Preview of the first matching message

total.description: Total number of sessions with matches

hasMore.description: Always false - session search returns all matching sessions without pagination

post.description: Connects a new MCP server dynamically

name.description: A unique name for the server

args.description: Array of arguments for the command (e.g., ['script.js'])

env.description: Optional environment variables for the server process

url.description: URL for the SSE server endpoint

persistToAgent.description: If true, saves the server to agent configuration file

schema.description: Request body for adding or updating an MCP server

get.description: Gets a list of all connected and failed MCP servers
Retrieves the list of tools available on a specific MCP server

parameters.description: The ID of the MCP server

inputSchema.description: JSON Schema for tool input parameters

schema.description: List of tools from MCP server

parameters.description: The ID of the MCP server

parameters.description: The ID of the MCP server
parameters.name: serverId

schema.description: The name of the tool to execute

parameters.description: The name of the tool to execute
parameters.name: toolName

schema.description: Tool execution parameters as JSON object. The specific fields depend on the tool being executed and are defined by the tool's inputSchema.

get.description: Retrieves all resources available from a specific MCP server

parameters.description: The ID of the MCP server

source.description: Source system that provides this resource

size.description: Size of the resource in bytes (if known)

metadata.description: Additional metadata specific to the resource type

schema.description: The URI-encoded resource identifier on that server

parameters.description: The URI-encoded resource identifier on that server
parameters.name: resourceId

post.description: Registers a new webhook endpoint to receive agent events

url.description: The URL to send webhook events to (must be a valid HTTP/HTTPS URL)

secret.description: A secret key for HMAC signature verification

description.description: A description of the webhook for reference

Fetches details for a specific webhook

parameters.name: webhookId

get.description: Retrieves all available prompts, including both built-in and custom prompts

post.description: Creates a new custom prompt with optional resource attachment. Maximum request size: 10MB

name.description: Unique name for the custom prompt

description.description: Description of what the prompt does

content.description: The prompt content text (can include {{argumentName}} placeholders)

mimeType.description: MIME type of the resource (e.g., text/plain, application/pdf)

resource.description: Attach a resource to this prompt

schema.description: Request body for creating a custom prompt with optional resource attachment

delete.description: Permanently deletes a custom prompt. Built-in prompts cannot be deleted

parameters.description: The prompt name
parameters.name: name

parameters.name: context

parameters.description: Arguments to substitute in the prompt template (pass as a JSON string)
parameters.name: args

get.description: Retrieves a list of all available resources from all sources (MCP servers and internal providers)

size.description: Size of the resource in bytes (if known)

metadata.description: Additional metadata specific to the resource type

contents.description: Array of content items (typically one item)

head.description: Checks if a resource exists by its URI without retrieving its content

parameters.description: The URI-encoded resource identifier
parameters.name: resourceId

post.description: Submit a user decision for a pending approval request

schema.description: The ID of the approval request

parameters.description: The ID of the approval request
parameters.name: approvalId

schema.description: Optional key to ensure idempotent processing

parameters.description: Optional key to ensure idempotent processing
parameters.name: Idempotency-Key

formData.description: Optional form data provided by the user (for elicitation)

rememberChoice.description: Whether to remember this choice for future requests

schema.description: Request body for submitting an approval decision

ok.description: Whether the approval was successfully processed

approvalId.description: The ID of the processed approval

404.description: Approval request not found or expired

503.description: Approval coordinator unavailable (server not initialized for approvals)

get.description: Retrieves all agents (installed, available, and current active agent)

id.description: Agent identifier (null if no active agent)

name.description: Agent display name (null if no active agent)

get.description: Retrieves the currently active agent

id.description: Agent identifier (null if no active agent)

name.description: Agent display name (null if no active agent)

post.description: Installs an agent from the registry or from a custom source

name.description: Display name (defaults to derived from id)

sourcePath.description: Path to agent configuration file or directory

main.description: Main configuration file name within source directory

metadata.description: Agent metadata including description, author, and tags

injectPreferences.description: Whether to inject user preferences into agent config

anyOf.description: Request body for installing a custom agent from file system

path.description: Optional absolute file path for file-based agents (e.g., "/path/to/agent.yml")

anyOf.description: Agent identifier for switching agents by ID or file path

post.description: Switches to a different agent by ID or file path

path.description: Optional absolute file path for file-based agents (e.g., "/path/to/agent.yml")

schema.description: Agent identifier for switching agents by ID or file path

post.description: Checks if an agent ID conflicts with existing agents

path.description: Optional absolute file path for file-based agents (e.g., "/path/to/agent.yml")

schema.description: Agent identifier for switching agents by ID or file path

valid.description: Whether the agent name is valid

conflict.description: Type of conflict if name is invalid

post.description: Removes an agent from the system. Custom agents are removed from registry; builtin agents can be reinstalled

force.description: Force uninstall even if agent is currently active

schema.description: Request body for uninstalling an agent

post.description: Creates a new custom agent from scratch via the UI/API

priority.description: Execution priority of the contributor (lower numbers run first)

enabled.description: Whether this contributor is currently active

content.description: Static content for the contributor (REQUIRED for 'static')

priority.description: Execution priority of the contributor (lower numbers run first)

enabled.description: Whether this contributor is currently active

source.description: Source identifier for dynamic content (REQUIRED for 'dynamic')

priority.description: Execution priority of the contributor (lower numbers run first)

enabled.description: Whether this contributor is currently active

files.description: Array of file paths to include as context (.md and .txt files)

includeFilenames.description: Whether to include the filename as a header for each file

separator.description: Separator to use between multiple files

errorHandling.description: How to handle missing or unreadable files: skip (ignore) or error (throw)

includeMetadata.description: Whether to include file metadata (size, modification time) in the context

items.description: Configuration for a system prompt contributor. Type 'static' requires 'content', type 'dynamic' requires 'source', type 'file' requires 'files'.

contributors.description: An array of contributor configurations that make up the system prompt

systemPrompt.description: System prompt: string shorthand or structured config

model.description: Specific model name for the selected provider

apiKey.description: API key for provider; can be given directly or via $ENV reference

baseURL.description: Base URL for provider (e.g., https://api.openai.com/v1). Only certain providers support this.

maxInputTokens.description: Max input tokens for history; required for unknown models

allowedMediaTypes.description: MIME type patterns for media expansion (e.g., "image/*", "application/pdf"). If omitted, uses model capabilities from registry. Supports wildcards.

llm.description: Core LLM configuration for the agent

description.description: Detailed description of agent purpose and capabilities

url.description: Primary endpoint URL for the agent

default.name: chat_with_agent
default.description: Allows you to chat with an AI agent. Send a message to interact.
examples: Send a JSON-RPC request to /mcp with method: "chat_with_agent" and params: {"message":"Your query..."}
Alternatively, use a compatible MCP client library.

iconUrl.description: URL to agent icon/logo (for UI display)

additionalInterfaces.description: Additional interfaces/transports supported by the agent

scopes.description: Available scopes for the OAuth2 flow
Available scopes for the OAuth2 flow
Available scopes for the OAuth2 flow
Available scopes for the OAuth2 flow

securitySchemes.description: Map of security scheme definitions (A2A format)

security.description: Security requirements (array of security scheme references with required scopes)

supportsAuthenticatedExtendedCard.description: Whether extended card is available with authentication

signatures.description: JSON Web Signatures for verifying AgentCard integrity

endpoint.description: Delegation endpoint (relative path or full URL)

delegation.description: Delegation protocol information for agent-to-agent communication

userId.description: Unique user identifier from auth system

email.description: Optional user email (WARNING: publicly readable via .well-known/agent.json if provided)

greeting.description: Default greeting text to show when a chat starts (for UI consumption)

telemetry.description: OpenTelemetry configuration for distributed tracing and observability

enabled.description: Whether to include memories in system prompt (opt-in)

includeTimestamps.description: Whether to include timestamps in memory display

includeTags.description: Whether to include tags in memory display

limit.description: Maximum number of memories to include

memories.description: Memory configuration for system prompt inclusion (opt-in feature)

agentId.description: Unique identifier for this agent instance - CLI enrichment derives from agentCard.name or filename

args.description: Array of arguments for the command (e.g., ['script.js'])

env.description: Optional environment variables for the server process

url.description: URL for the SSE server endpoint

mcpServers.description: Configurations for MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers used by the agent

internalTools.description: Internal tools configuration (read-file, write-file, bash-exec, etc.)

maxSize.description: Max file size in bytes before rotation (default: 10MB)

maxFiles.description: Max number of rotated files to keep (default: 5)

listName.description: Redis list name for log entries

batchSize.description: Number of log entries to batch before sending (default: 100)

oneOf.description: Upstash Redis transport for remote logging

logger.description: Logger configuration with multi-transport support (file, console, remote) - CLI enrichment adds per-agent file transport

path.description: SQLite database file path (required for SQLite - CLI enrichment provides per-agent path)

maxBlobSize.description: Maximum size per blob in bytes

maxTotalSize.description: Maximum total storage size in bytes

storePath.description: Blob storage directory path (required for local storage - CLI enrichment provides per-agent default)

maxBlobSize.description: Maximum size per blob in bytes

maxTotalSize.description: Maximum total storage size in bytes

cleanupAfterDays.description: Auto-cleanup blobs older than N days

blob.description: Blob store configuration (for large, unstructured data)

storage.description: Storage configuration for cache, database, and blob storage - defaults to in-memory, CLI enrichment provides filesystem paths

maxSessions.description: Maximum number of concurrent sessions allowed, defaults to 100

sessionTTL.description: Session time-to-live in milliseconds, defaults to 3600000ms (1 hour)

mode.description: Tool confirmation mode: manual (interactive), auto-approve (all tools), auto-deny (no tools)

timeout.description: Timeout for tool confirmation requests in milliseconds, defaults to 120000ms (2 mins)

allowedToolsStorage.description: Storage type for remembered tool approvals: memory (session-only) or storage (persistent)

alwaysAllow.description: Tools that never require approval (low-risk). Use full qualified names (e.g., "internal--ask_user", "mcp--filesystem--read_file")

alwaysDeny.description: Tools that are always denied (high-risk). Takes precedence over alwaysAllow. Use full qualified names (e.g., "mcp--filesystem--delete_file")

toolPolicies.description: Static tool policies for fine-grained allow/deny control. Deny list takes precedence over allow list.

enabled.description: Enable elicitation support (ask_user tool and MCP server elicitations). When disabled, elicitation requests will be rejected.

timeout.description: Timeout for elicitation requests in milliseconds, defaults to 120000ms (2 mins)

elicitation.description: Elicitation configuration for user input requests (ask_user tool and MCP server elicitations). Independent from toolConfirmation mode.

paths.description: File paths or directories to expose as resources (at least one required)

maxFiles.description: Maximum number of files to include (default: 1000)

includeHidden.description: Include hidden files and directories (default: false)

items.description: File extension pattern starting with a dot; supports multi-part extensions

includeExtensions.description: File extensions to include (default: common text files)

oneOf.description: Blob resource provider configuration - actual storage settings are in storage.blob section

enabled.description: Explicit toggle; auto-enabled when resources are non-empty

paths.description: File paths or directories to expose as resources (at least one required)

maxFiles.description: Maximum number of files to include (default: 1000)

includeHidden.description: Include hidden files and directories (default: false)

items.description: File extension pattern starting with a dot; supports multi-part extensions

includeExtensions.description: File extensions to include (default: common text files)

oneOf.description: Blob resource provider configuration - actual storage settings are in storage.blob section

id.description: Kebab-case slug id for the starter prompt (e.g., quick-start)

title.description: Display title for the starter prompt

description.description: Description shown on hover or in the UI

prompt.description: The actual prompt text that gets resolved and sent

category.description: Category for organizing starter prompts (e.g., general, coding, analysis, tools, learning)

starterPrompts.description: Agent-specific starter prompts configuration (used by WebUI and PromptManager)

blocking.description: If true, plugin errors will halt execution

contentPolicy.description: Content policy plugin for input validation and sanitization

blocking.description: If true, plugin errors will halt execution

responseSanitizer.description: Response sanitizer plugin for output sanitization

module.description: Absolute path to plugin module (use ${{dexto.agent_dir}} for agent-relative paths)

blocking.description: If true, plugin errors will halt execution

plugins.description: Plugin system configuration for built-in and custom plugins

schema.description: Request body for creating a new custom agent with full configuration

get.description: Retrieves the file path of the currently active agent configuration

path.description: Absolute path to agent configuration file

isDefault.description: Whether this is the default agent

get.description: Retrieves the raw YAML configuration of the currently active agent

post.description: Saves and applies YAML agent configuration. Creates backup before saving

yaml.description: YAML agent configuration content to save

schema.description: Request body for saving agent configuration YAML

changesApplied.description: List of changes that were applied

post.description: Validates YAML agent configuration without saving it

yaml.description: YAML agent configuration content to validate

schema.description: Request body for validating agent configuration YAML

get.description: Exports the effective agent configuration with sensitive values redacted

schema.description: Session identifier to export session-specific configuration

parameters.description: Session identifier to export session-specific configuration
parameters.name: sessionId
